page.title: 15FISHING
page.content: There are six fishing boats working out of Barling Creek. They are called Nicholas, Win, De Hoop, Buzzard, Sylvia and Gandalf. One of the boats has a 150 horse power engine and is 13 metres long. The other boats are about the same length. In the summer they often fish for sole around the sands of the Thames Estuary. They also stretch a net between two boats to catch sprats. The sprats are sold to factory ships from Russia or Norway. The boats fish for scallops near Rye or whitebait in the Wash. In winter they pull rakes to collect whiteweed or trawl for cod. The boats are usually out for 18 hours at a time. The best fishing is when the tides are moderate, as the fish can see the net if mud is not stirred up by the moving water.
